common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Bugs and Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting various bugs with the Pieces Desktop Application, including issues with the "Secret Message" example, unresponsive behavior, and high CPU usage. Some users have found temporary workarounds, such as rebooting PiecesOS. The Pieces support team is actively investigating these issues and working on solutions.

related_issues.title: "Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
related_issues.text:
"Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Conversation Summary:

**Key points raised:**

* Some users are experiencing the app running in "basic mode due to device constraints".
* This seems to occur on M3 Macs despite having adequate hardware.
* The issue prevents access to Workstream Activity and updates from the LTM engine.
* An "unknown origin" element version 1.0.10 appears in the telemetry browser.

**Problems identified:**

* The app is incorrectly detecting certain M3 Macs as lacking necessary hardware, resulting in "basic mode" limitations.
* Users are unable to view Workstream Activity and LTM updates due to the app being in basic mode.
* The origin of the "unknown origin" element remains unclear.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Rebooting PiecesOS temporarily resolves the "basic mode" issue.
* A fix for the incorrect hardware detection is planned for the next PiecesOS version.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The bug causing the "basic mode" issue on M3 Macs is acknowledged and will be fixed in the next update.
* A temporary workaround exists by rebooting PiecesOS.
* The functionality of Workstream Activity and LTM updates should be restored once the fix is implemented.
* The "unknown origin" element requires further investigation.

**Additional notes:**

* The "device constraints" message lacks clear documentation, requiring clarification.
* The app version information appears inconsistent, suggesting potential configuration issues.

related_issues.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* A bug was reported where files are not loading into the context after sending 11 requests and receiving 11 responses.
* The reporter was unable to reproduce the issue on their end.

**Problems Identified:**

* Files are not being loaded into the context, causing potential issues with subsequent requests.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No solutions were proposed or implemented in the conversation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains open and unresolved. 
* The Pieces support team has been notified and is investigating the issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was directed to some related issues and helpful resources. 
* It is recommended to monitor the issue for updates from the Pieces support team.

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* @bpluly reported experiencing slowdowns on their PC due to Long Term Memory (LTM).
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces support team.
* Related issues were suggested for reference.

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM was causing performance issues on the user's PC.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No specific solutions were proposed in this initial conversation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been acknowledged by the Pieces support team and they will follow up within 24 hours.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Extension Bugs and Unexpected Behavior
common_issues.description: Users reported issues with the Pieces OS Chrome extension, including console log flooding due to port sniffing and unexpected responses from the chat assistant. The console log issue was resolved in a recent update (v4.0.4). The chat assistant issue involves delayed responses and is still under investigation. Users facing similar issues are advised to update to the latest extension version and provide detailed bug reports for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension messing out stackoverflow
related_issues.text:
Chrome Extension messing out stackoverflow

### Software

Desktop Application, Web Extension

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

It fills this text endlessly...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6b5edb10-b7cf-4fa6-a523-aa73af94cbee)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@luceat-lux-vestra) reported an issue with embed buttons on a specific page.

**Problems Identified:**

* Enabling embed buttons on the page caused the issue.
* No other solution was found besides disabling them.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Disable embed buttons for the specific page.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was resolved by disabling embed buttons.
* The user confirmed the solution worked.

**Additional Notes:**

* The fix was documented for future reference.
* The developer acknowledged the need for a more permanent solution.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary **Key Points Raised:** * Pieces OS extension unexpectedly flooded the browser's developer console with failed network requests. * This issue arose due to Pieces OS's recent update, which made it impossible to rely on a designated port for the OS. * The failed requests were attempts to check if the Pieces OS API was running, not to scan the user's machine. **Problems Identified:** * The failed requests cluttered the developer console, making it difficult to distinguish real errors from phantom ones. * The unexpected behavior could raise privacy concerns despite its harmless nature. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * **Initial:** Hiding or better handling error messages from inactive port checks. * **Final:** Fixed in the latest web extension update (version 4.0.4). This involved addressing a potential Chrome bug. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue has been resolved. Users are advised to download the latest web extension version (4.0.4) to prevent the network request flooding. **Additional Information:** * Users can also manually disable network logs in the developer console settings, although this might not be ideal for everyone.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Conflicts and Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts between Pieces OS and other applications, particularly Ollama Server, leading to Cuda DLL errors and system slowdowns. Solutions include reinstalling software, cleaning environment paths, and updating Pieces OS. Some issues persist, prompting requests for improved compatibility and performance optimization.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Conversation Summary: 

**Key Points:**

* **User experiencing Cuda DLL errors with Ollama Server on Pieces OS.**
* **Multiple uninstalls and reinstalls of both Pieces OS and Ollama did not resolve the issue initially.**
* **Problem eventually resolved itself after additional uninstalls and path cleanups.**
* **User requesting feature to prevent Pieces OS from installing Ollama Server if external instance detected.**

**Problems Identified:**

* Cuda DLL errors with Ollama Server on Pieces OS.
* Pieces OS attempting to run Ollama Server even when an external instance is already running.
* Race condition between Pieces OS startup and external Ollama Server startup.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Uninstalling and reinstalling Ollama and Pieces OS.
* Cleaning up environment paths.
* Updating Pieces OS to version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Problem appears to be resolved after updating Pieces OS to version 11.1.2, but user will continue to monitor.
* User requests feature to prevent Pieces OS from installing Ollama Server if external instance detected.

**Additional Notes:**

* Issue may be related to startup order of Pieces OS and external Ollama Server.
* Developer of Pieces OS plans to investigate race condition further.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS installation, updates, and Personal Domain backup/restore. Problems include update failures, Trojan detection by antivirus software, and difficulties restoring backups on new devices. Suggested solutions involve updating App Installer, configuring antivirus exceptions, and contacting Pieces support for personalized assistance.

related_issues.title: Personal Domain backup
related_issues.text:
Personal Domain backup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I want to sync this PC to another PC，but i cann't backup the lastest data.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bfb4fb14-5e7f-45c7-828f-5f77f550453a)

this is another PC

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c2d880e-a1b2-40c1-82b1-9935bffbf8fb)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** User laborer123 is unable to change their Personal Domain after copying the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folders to a new computer. 

**Key points raised:**

- User wants to back up their current computer and restore to a new computer using their existing Personal Domain.
- User is unable to back up their current computer due to an old backup already existing in the system.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

1. **Domain registration issue:**
    * Mark from Pieces support suggests registering a new domain.
2. **Backup/restore issue:**
    * Click on the refresh button to initiate a restore process. This will overwrite local files with cloud backup.

**Current status/outcome:**

- It's unclear whether the user tried registering a new domain.
- It's unclear whether the refresh icon was clicked to initiate the restore. 

**Next Steps:**

related_issues.title: Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
related_issues.text:
Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

There's no opportunity for the User to choose where the Pieces OS is installed or where any data that's collected is stored. From Windows 10 onwards there is a system feature to set where new content is to be stored by default. This is in Settings/System/Storage.

You can set where new Apps will be installed, new documents are stored, Music, etc.

Once this is set I would expect a current application to follow the default installation setting rather than hardcode it for the Boot drive.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @bpluly created an issue.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* The user may find related issues ([#654](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/654) and [#633](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/633)) helpful.

**Problems Identified:**

* No specific problems are identified in the snippet provided.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No solutions are proposed or implemented in the snippet provided.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being triaged and will be addressed by the Pieces team within 24 hours.

**Additional Information:**

* The user is directed to resources such as existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel for further information.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Update fails
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Update fails
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The notification popped up saying an update was available so I clicked Update and a few seconds later got this message box:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b14dc8ab-632a-4095-b45b-7bbaba3c70ce)

This is on a very fresh Windows 11 installation.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* @ThatRendle reported an error when launching PiecesOS on Windows.
* @ThatRendle mentioned possibly related issues with launching PiecesOS.
* @bejokun reported the same issue and received a Trojan detection message.

**Problems Identified:**

* Potential bug with App Installer technology on Windows.
* Trojan detection by Kaspersky antivirus.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update App Installer through Microsoft Store.
* Configure Kaspersky to allow PiecesOS processes.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* @ThatRendle hasn't confirmed whether the proposed solution resolved the issue.
* @bejokun was not satisfied with the suggestion to allow a Trojan-detected application.
* The root cause of the Trojan detection remains unclear.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation indicates that the issue might be specific to Windows users and related to the App Installer technology.
* Further investigation and communication are needed to resolve the issue for both users and address the Trojan detection concern.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Update and Launch Failures
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS failing to update or launch on Windows. This might be related to App Installer technology or false positive Trojan detection by antivirus software like Kaspersky. Suggested workarounds include updating App Installer, configuring antivirus exceptions, or reinstalling Pieces OS. However, the root cause remains unclear, and further investigation is needed.

## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS Unable to Launch

**Key Points:**

* **User:** @fardin631 reported the `PiecesOS Unable to Launch` issue.
* **Date:** 2025-03-14T06:42:28+00:00
* **Related Issues:** The support bot suggested three similar issues for reference.
* **Resources:** The bot also provided links to existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS was unable to launch, preventing the user from interacting with the software.

**Solutions:**

* No specific solutions provided in the initial conversation. The issue was routed for further analysis within 24 hours.

**Current Status:**

* The issue was acknowledged and assigned to the proper team member within the next 24 hours.
* Further investigation or updates are expected from the Pieces support team.

recommendations: **Prioritize bug fixes for Pieces Desktop Application:** Focus on resolving issues related to the "Secret Message" example, unresponsive behavior, and high CPU usage.
**Investigate and address Pieces OS Extension issues:** Continue investigating delayed responses from the chat assistant and monitor for new bug reports related to the extension.

**Improve Pieces OS compatibility and performance:** Address conflicts with applications like Ollama Server, optimize performance to reduce system slowdowns, and investigate the root cause of Cuda DLL errors.
